20.text:
Me and Joey were one in a million, 
 I think.

25.text:
But we was only actually officially 
 together for a few months.

27.text:
I think we slit up because we rushed
 into things a little bit too much.

31.text:
I got scared of the commitment 
 and pushed her away.

33.text:
Things were difficult between us, 
 having distance between homes,

53.text:
"Were we too different 
 to be together?"

60.text:
Yes, I think. Difficult to make 
 time for each other -

64.text:
Different backgrounds, 
 different where we live.

66.text:
Like, your social life 
 and your work life...

68.text:
When you say "social", 
 what do you mean?

70.text:
Like, you go out a lot 
 and, like, just see your mates,

74.text: No, I... No, I don't. Yes, you do.

76.text:
Like, you'll say... "I'm going out 
 with the girls tonight."

79.text:
And then it'll be nine o'clock 
 and you'll be like,

81.text:
"Oh, the girls are busy. 
 Do you want to come round?"

83.text:
And be like, drop of a hat, 
 "Do you want to come?"

87.text:
It was your choice at the start, 
 to split up,

90.text:
and...here you are today... 
 I guarantee...

93.text:
She likes to click her fingers 
 and hope I'll come running,

97.text:
and that's not always 
 the best things for a relationship.

100.text:
'Spending time with her 
 is difficult to come by.'

103.text:
Do you think that, cos you live 
 an hour and a half away,

105.text:
it's difficult to 
 have a relationship? 100%.

109.text: Rianna lived quite far away from me,

110.text:
so I'd only really saw her 
 at the weekends.

112.text:
It was kind of like a one-way thing 
 where he'd make all the effort,

116.text:
which probably made it harder, 
 as he probably thought

120.text:
he was pulling his weight 
 a lot more than I was.

122.text:
How many times you driven to me 
 in three years?

124.text:
Despite you saying, 
 "I want this to work."

129.text:
Four times. So that's once a year, 
 basically.

132.text:
Don't make it out like it's 
 just all me. It's not all me.

135.text:
He thinks that it's sort of 
 all my fault, why we didn't work.

138.text:
I felt like he threw that 
 at me a lot.

148.text:
Your best one's probably you 
 are a caring person, deep down.

153.text:
Like, I'm quite just laid-back and 
 chilled, whereas you're very...

156.text:
You're laid-back and chilled? 
 I think I'm quite laid-back.

159.text:
I feel like you don't know yourself.
 Yeah, I do know myself...

161.text:
and you're quite bubbly 
 and crazy and mental.

165.text:
I do fancy Joey because he has got 
 this personality, for one,

173.text: I think you're funny. Do you?

175.text:
You always say 
 I've got terrible banter.

177.text:
You do have terrible banter - 
 but you are funny.

180.text:
I could probably rely on you 
 on a bad day.

182.text:
We've always just had this thing 
 where we find each other back again.

186.text:
I don't know how it works, 
 or what makes it work,

189.text:
but we just have that contact 
 and that friendship

192.text: that we just can't let go.

194.text:
I would say it's love. 
 He might say it's different.

207.text:
Don't choke on your cheesecake. 
 SHE LAUGHS

209.text:
I want this meal to be 
 an opportunity

212.text: for me and Joey to have closure.

214.text:
'We either need to be together, 
 or not be together.'

224.text:
Yes, I think you are. Really? 
 I don't want to be with anyone else.

229.text:
Because I know it's here already. 
 Right.

232.text:
I'm not trying to be cheesy - 
 I'm just saying.

242.text:
You're taking a bit long 
 to answer, so...

245.text:
Despite being on and off, 
 I still have strong feelings...

247.text:
Oh, don't say that, 
 don't say that...

249.text:
I don't know how I feel 
 about her - that's the problem.

251.text:
Don't want to pour my heart out 
 on telly.

252.text:
She was the first person 
 I proper had feelings for,

254.text:
so even though it's three years on, 
 I still...like speaking to her.

259.text:
See, I don't know, 
 cos nothing's perfect.

261.text: I look for everything to be perfect,

262.text:
and if it's the one, 
 everything will be perfect.

264.text:
If you was the one, 
 you'd live near me and then...

269.text:
You'd be attending everything 
 with me and we'd be an item.

272.text:
Would you move closer to me 
 to be the one, or...?

276.text: I want to say yeah... Mm.

280.text:
..but I don't know if I'd 
 be able to go through with it.

283.text:
It is a big commitment, obviously, 
 if I was to move down with you...

288.text:
..and I'd think mainly, for me, 
 it'd be work, cos it'd just...

291.text:
Like, it would 
 just be a bit of a nightmare.

293.text:
'So if she made time for me, 
 things would probably work.'

296.text:
I don't know, maybe now we've 
 grown up, things might change.

305.text:
You're still my best mate, 
 and we can carry on like that...

307.text:
or what you want to... 
 see each other more.

309.text: I haven't seen you for ages, so...

311.text:
Is that you saying... No, I'm 
 asking you. ..I'd like to see you?

314.text: I'm asking you. I'm not telling you.

316.text:
I think I'm going to take up 
 the offer. I'm going to see you...

321.text:
That was not offering. You so was. 
 That was a question.

323.text:
I was questioning your question. 
 Do you want to see me more?

326.text:
I was answering your question 
 with a question. Yeah...

328.text:
Nowadays, we both worked very hard, 
 we have to...

334.text:
..make the effort to see each other 
 as much as possible.

339.text:
Like, I'm willing to...to, 
 you know, try again.

342.text:
To make a bit more effort, yeah? 
 Yeah.

344.text:
And you know I will. I told you. 
 I've just grown up so much.

347.text:
Yeah, I'm just saying, 
 I haven't really got time.

352.text:
Not not see you, but before, 
 I'm not going to come running,

355.text:
put if we plan ahead for weekends 
 or things, I can see you more.

359.text:
I'll put in the effort, 
 as well, obviously...

361.text: just to see how things go.

363.text:
Like, see if we could get back 
 to where we was...

368.text:
Great. I'm fed up of being your 
 friend. Fed up of being my friend?

374.text:
Did you get your lashes done? 
 I did, I did.

378.text:
Leaving with Joey today 
 makes me feel...

384.text:
just to see what the future 
 can hold for us.

387.text:
it'll be nice to take things 
 to the next level.
